name: caduceo
text: Burritos and being on the can have a strange synergy that I cannot explain

name: abe
text: Amen, bruvva'.

name: ralgnar
text: It's all in the beans, man.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Yeah, I think that synergy is pretty clear to anyone who has ever eaten a burrito.

name: lawbot
text: It's called burritolingus.

name: relaxing
text: Oh my god I can't buy a burrito from someone who has done oral on me

name: ambala
text: Blister is accusatory without using punctuation.

name: ghostd
text: I think the more pressing question is why Lyle's record player needs cleaning and why Phillipe is the one to do it. Mysteries upon mysteries.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: he is either trying to do something good or has just done something bad

name: norrin
text: Lyle's record player needs cleaning because he is a filthy person. Phillipe is the one to do it because he is easily talked into doing things.

name: hamscout
text: I think Phillipe just tried to "play" a tostada...

name: lux
text: The real question is: why Q-tips?

name: tekende
text: Q-tips and rubbing alcohol are good for cleaning things like NES cartridges and, presumably, record players.

name: tibia
text: Rubbing alcohol can leave a deposit on NES carts.  I'd imagine it also can do it to records.  Better off with denatured alcohol from the hardware store.  Much higher purity level.

name: rowboat
text: Damn, Tekende! You just gonna sit there and take that?

name: a_dude
text: Classic scene of being in the same room while someone is poopin.

name: deancain29
text: Philippe!

name: evolume
text: this is one of my first favorite strips.

name: woodenteeth
text: They were in the middle of Burritos. Half way through they decided to visit the Can. Both of them. That's some fast acting beans.

name: dorothypoopbot
text: Todd T. Squirrel does not eat any other kind.

name: tekende
text: I think they came to the bathroom because they heard Cornelius yelling and decided to check it out.

name: notcool
text: [b]S-S-SCREW YOU! I ONLY EAT DOUBLE BEANS![/b[

name: notcool
text:
Ahem.

S-S-SCREW YOU! I ONLY POST DOUBLE BBCODE!

name: spinynorman
text:
Blister is proof that sometimes caps lock can make something funnier.

Most of the written internet world is proof against said claim, though.

name: senatorexlax
text: The comic that is up today is an incredibly similar situation.

name: deusoma
text: I love how Phillipe can bend over without moving his legs at all.

name: coco
text: I love how Mr. Bear's legs barely come past the edge of the toilet, and yet there he is, perched atop the can . . . is there a step ladder stashed somewhere? How did he get up there?

name: snowman
text: Corny has Charlie Brown feet.

name: rowboat
text:
"Here, put these shoes on and have legs like mine."

-Dead Charlie Brown

name: especial
text: That is one of my favorite Achewoods of all time.

name: missbee
text: This reminds me of the one where Phillipe hides behind the toilet and talks to Connie. I can't find it when I search though :/

name: joestork
text:
See, this is the exactly the kind of old Achewood comic that deserves a WAY higher score than it has.

For shame.

name: a_knobbie
text: Mr. Bear's fault for not locking the doors;I lock the doors even when there's no one in the house.

name: rowboat
text: In which a_knobbie strongly hints at a troubled past.

name: ham_shoes
text: It could be said that the bear was "in the middle of burritos" too, if you catch my drift.  How embarrassing!

name: rhymebomb
text: What did they expect walking into a bathroom? That's the place place a person goes when they're about to enjoy a burrito.

name: i_love_kate
text: My goodness... The Parson's Gambit!
